[[Playhouse Disney]]
[[Disney Cinemagic]] |slogan = We look together |former names= [[Jetix (Russia)|Jetix]] ([[10 August]] [[2010]])
[[Semyorka (TV channel)|Semyorka]] ([[1 January]] [[2012]]) |web= http://www.disney.ru/kanal/| |sat serv 1=Available on most satellite systems| |sat chan 1=Check local listings for channels| |cable serv 1=Available on most cable systems| |cable chan 1=Check local listings for channels| |cable serv 2= |cable chan 2= }} '''Disney Channel Russia''' is a television channel owned by [[The Walt Disney Company]], which began broadcast in [[Russia]] and other [[CIS]] countries. It replaced '''[[Jetix (Russia)|Jetix]]. While Disney previously planned to launch Disney Channel Russia as an over-the-air service in 2009, their deal with a Russian media company was rejected by Russian authorities. Disney Channel is available as a cable and satellite channel, and is made available via the regular operators (such as [[NTV Plus]]). A registration request was filed in 2010 with the Russian media authority Roscomnadzor.http://www.rbcdaily.ru/2010/03/16/media/464670 ''"ÐÐ½Ð¸Ð³Ð° Ð¼Ð°ÑÑÐµÑÐ¾Ð²" Ð¿Ð¾ÑÐ»Ð° Ð¿Ð¾ Ð¼Ð¸ÑÑ'' (''[The film] The Book of Masters goes around the world'') (in Russian)
In the interview, Walt Disney Company CIS director Marina Zhigalova-Ozkan says:
{{quote|We decided to give up our plans to enter the over-the-air TV segment. Currently all our efforts are centered on the development of our Jetix channel. Apart from that, we recently filed documents with Roscomnadzor for the registration of the Disney Channel. Now the document review period has been extended to six months.}} On March 9, 2010 the Russian TV authority granted Walt Disney Company CIS a cable television broadcasting license (#15922). Later it was announced that the change will happen on August 10, 2010.{{cite web| title = Disney going to start | publisher = ComNews | url = http://www.comnews.ru/index.cfm?id=52866}}{{cite web| title = Russian viewers will be able to watch Disney channel programs of August | publisher = Lenizdat.Ru | url = http://www.lenizdat.ru/a0/ru/pm1/c-1089446-0.html}}{{cite web| title = One of Disney will be more | publisher = Izvestiya.Ru | url = http://www.izvestiya.ru/tv/article3141996/}}{{cite web| title = The new Disney Channel will appear on the cable and satellite TV in Russia | publisher = RIA Novosti | url = http://www.rian.ru/media/20100520/236423531.html}}http://disney.ru/DisneyCMS/Content/CompanyNews/104.jsp Disney Channel Russia replaced Jetix Russia, making it the last Jetix-branded channel in the world to close. Unlike many other Disney Channels in Europe, which broadcast a single video feed with several language tracks, this version is custom-made for Russia. For example, the Playhouse Disney block (to be renamed Disney Junior in 2012) is known on screen by its Russian title (from [[Channel 1 (Russia)|Russian TV Channel 1]]) ''Ð£Ð·Ð½Ð°Ð²Ð°Ð¹ÐºÐ°''. ---- {{multicol}} === Films Disney Studios === * Â«[[Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl]]Â» * Â«[[Freaky Friday]]Â» * Â«[[Moms on Strike]]Â» * Â«[[Rocket's Red Glare]]Â» * Â«[[Cow Belles]]Â» * Â«[[Casper Meets Wendy]]Â» * Â«[[Richie Rich's Christmas Wish]]Â» * Â«[[The Christmas List]]Â» * Â«[[Christmas Do-Over]]Â» * Â«[[The Book of Masters]]Â» (Russia) * Â«[[Hannah Montana: The Movie]]Â» * Â«[[My Date with the President's Daughter]]Â» * Â«[[Au Pair]]Â» * Â«[[Au Pair II]]Â» * Â«[[Enchanted]]Â» * Â«[[The Princess Diaries]]Â» ==== Be accurately translated ==== * Â«[[Aladdin and the King of Thieves]]Â» '''Will be broadcast in the future:''' * Â«[[Au Pair 3: Adventure in Paradise]]Â» * Â«[[Santa Buddies]]Â» * Â«[[Ice Princess]]Â» {{multicol-break}} === Full-length animated films Disney Studios === * Â«[[Finding Nemo]]Â» * Â«[[Aladdin (1992 Disney film)|Aladdin]]Â» * Â«[[Chicken Little (2005 film)|Chicken Little]]Â» * Â«[[Beauty and the Beast]]Â» * Â«[[Cars (film)|Cars]]Â» '''Will be broadcast in the future:''' * Â«[[Monsters, inc.]]Â» * Â«[[The Nightmare Before Christmas]]Â» * Â«[[The Jungle Book]]Â» === Live performances and special programs === * Â«[[Jonas Brothers: The 3D Concert Experience]]Â» * Â«[[Hannah Montana & Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert]]Â» * Â«[[My Camp Rock: The final show]]Â» (Russia) * Â«[[Celebration Disney Channel]]Â» (Russia) * Â«[[Hit Parade Disney Channel]]Â» (Russia) * Â«[[Music video marathon Phineas and Ferb]]Â» (Russia) '''Will be broadcast in the future:''' * Â«[[High School Musical: The Concert]]Â» * Â«[[The Cheetah Girls: The Concert]]Â» {{multicol-end}} == Marathons == *March 20th 2011, "Sunny Day". Marathon of Jonas L.A. and two Sunny Movies. *March 26th 2011, "The Time Traveler Day". Episodes of shows about time travels, premiere of Minutemen. *April 1st 2011, "Topsy-turvy Day". Episodes of shows where characters change over; at a 12.00 am "Disney Channel" logo was replaced to "Jetix" logo and there was 24 hours. After it was "Disney Channel" again. *April 17th 2011, "Hannah Montana's Day". 10 episodes of Hannah Montana, premiere of 3rd season and her concert. *April 9th 2011, "The Suite Day". 4 episodes of The Suite Life of Zack and Cody and premiere of season 3. *May 1st 2011, "Open Day". All crossovers; 3 special guests and premiere of Take Two with Phineas and Ferb. *May 13th 2011, "Not Scary Friday, 13". Not scare episodes and marathon of Wizards of Waverly Place. *May 22th 2011, "Funny Families". Family's episodes and premiere of 2 episodes Good Luck Charlie. *May 28th 2011, "Rock Day". My Camp Rock: Final Concert and premiere of Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam. *June 11th to 13th 2011, "Music Weekend". Musical episodes, premiere of "Disney Channel Hit-parade", premiere of "Disney Channel Concert Holiday", premiere of Phineas and Ferb's Musical Cliptastic Countdown, Hannah Montana's and Jonas Brothers' concerts. *June 19th 2011, "What's Mean Graduation?". Graduation episodes. *June 26th 2011, "S'Winter". Christmas and Winter episodes. *July 16th 2011, "Neptune Day". Water episodes. *August 10th 2011, "Disney Channel Birthday". One year later of start of Disney Channel Russia. Birthday episodes, premieres of Cars (film), Enchanted and Fish Hooks. *August 27th 2011, "Lights! Camera! Stop it!". Episodes of shows about movies, cinema. *September 3rd 2011, "Play Learning!". Episodes of shows about school. *September 10th 2011, "Luck VILLAGE Day!". Episodes of shows about travels, adventures and more. *September 17th 2011, "The Most Fashionable Day". Episodes about fashion and premiere of Sharpay's Fabulous Adventure. *September 24th 2011, "The Magic Day". 4 episodes of Wizards of Waverly Place, premiere of 3rd season, episodes of shows about magic. *October 1st 2011, "Saturday Under Cover". 3 episodes of Kim Possible, premieres of 2nd season of Aaron Stone and of Get a Clue, spy episodes of shows. *October 8th 2011, "All Aboard!". Analouge of "Neptune Day", premieres of The Suite Life on Deck and Phil of the Future and On a Boarding!. *October 15th 2011, "Oh, This Crazy, Crazy, Crazy, Crazy, Crazy Kids". Episodes of shows about kids, premiere of 2nd season of Good Luck Charlie. *October 22th 2011, "The Right Day!". The best episodes of shows, premieres of Hannah Montana Forever and The Princess' Diaries; Hannah Montana's concert. *October 30th to 31th 2011, "Double Halloween". The scariest episodes of animated series. *November 5th 2011, "The Extreme Weekend". Extreme episodes of shows, premiere of 2nd season of Kick Buttowski: Suburban Daredevil. *November 12th 2011, "Hatday". Episodes of shows about hats, premiere of So Random!. *November 19th 2011, "Royal Saturday". Episodes about kings and premiere of 2nd season of Pair of Kings and The Chronicles of Narnia (2005) *November 26th 2011, "Back to The Past". Analouge of March 26th. Premiere of Avalon High and Phil of the Future. *December 3rd 2011, "Finding the Real Treasure". Episodes about treasures or money.
